data.title: Tuesday evening news briefing: Sir Geoffrey Boycott reveals cancer diagnosis
data.meta_description: Also from the Front Page newsletter: Lucy Letby found guilty of trying to murder another baby girl. Sign up below.
data.text:
Good evening. Josh here to take you through Tuesday’s news.

Sir Geoffrey Boycott has revealed that he has been diagnosed with throat cancer for the second time and is to undergo surgery to treat the illness.

Elsewhere, convicted child killer Lucy Letby has been found guilty of trying to murder another premature baby girl following a retrial.

Plus: The latest updates from the general election campaign.

If you want to receive twice-daily briefings like this by email, sign up to the Front Page newsletter here.

Sir Geoffrey Boycott reveals cancer diagnosis

Boycott, the former England batsman, was told last week the cancer had returned more than 20 years after he was treated for the illness with a combination of chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Boycott, 83, is to undergo an operation to remove the cancer in two weeks’ time – read more here.

Lucy Letby found guilty of trying to murder another baby girl

The 34-year-old was accused of attempting to kill the infant by dislodging her breathing tube while she worked a night shift at the Countess of Chester Hospital’s neonatal unit in February 2016. Letby was convicted last August of the murders of seven babies and the attempted murder of six others.

Royal Mail blames snap election for postal vote delays

The courier called for a “review into the timetable for future elections”, to make sure that the postal voting system “works as smoothly as possible”. The Telegraph revealed on Monday that voters in more than 90 constituencies have raised concerns about their ballots failing to arrive – follow the latest here.

Meanwhile, Telegraph readers share their experiences with ballots failing to arrive in time and question the existence of postal voting as an option.

Revealed | Keir Starmer accepted £76k worth of gifts

Writers’ verdicts | Has Sunak destroyed the Tories forever?

Labour | Private school tax raid ‘punishes’ non-elite parents

Tom McPhail | Labour is coming for your pension freedoms

Discover | How Labour could clobber Britain with a ‘double death tax’

Election Q&A | Do you have a question for our tax expert?

Angela Rayner and Penny Mordaunt among politicians targeted by deepfake porn site

Doctored photographs of Angela Rayner, Penny Mordaunt and Gillian Keegan are being hosted on an explicit website with hundreds of images created using artificial intelligence.

The investigation for Channel 4 News found that Dehenna Davison, who is standing down as a Tory MP, and Stella Creasy, a Labour candidate, were also targeted by the site.

Evening Briefing: Today’s essential headlines

Leicestershire | Three police officers are under investigation for misconduct over their inquiries into an assault carried out by the Nottingham attacker the month before he killed three people.

Oxford | Student dies after jumping in river

Garrick Club | First female members revealed

Scouts | Association’s waiting list tops 100,000

Crime | Mark Duggan’s son admits firearms offence

Donald Trump | Sentencing delayed after immunity ruling

Ed Davey urges voters to topple Tory dominoes
